TaskStructure.Body: We anticipate this project requiring the services as indicated, however, at times issues arise which required additional services. When and if these circumstances arise we will be happy to supplement this proposal with tasks and costs.

If an alternative technology component is required as part of the system design we shall contact you prior to the commencement of any design work and will inform you of expected additional costs which would be shown as “extras” on your invoices.

We shall prepare a request to the Conservation Commission to amend the existing Order of Conditions. This request shall be submitted to the Conservation Commission and abutters will be notified of the hearing by certified mail/return receipt requested. <FEE>The fee for this service is $425.00</FEE> Our fee does not include the filing fee, cost of the legal ad to be published in the local newspaper or the cost of postage to notify abutters; all of which will be reflected on your bill as an out of pocket expense. We shall present the project at two regularly scheduled Conservation Commission public hearings. <FEE>The fee for this service is $400.00</FEE> <NOTE>Any meeting or site visit time over 2 hours will be charged at a rate of $125/hour, and any additional public hearings will be $200 (minimum).</NOTE>

Our office shall prepare an Abbreviated Notice of Resource Area Delineation (ANRAD) in order to get the wetland delineation approved by the Conservation Commission. This application will be filed with the Conservation Commission, abutters will be notified of the hearing by certified mail/return receipt requested, we shall attend the public hearings (estimate of 2 hearings), and we shall conduct one site visit as scheduled by the Commission. <BLANK> <CENTER>The fee for this service is $1,125.00</CENTER> <BLANK> <TAB>Our fee breakdown is as follows:</TAB> <DTAB>ANRAD = $525</DTAB> <DTAB>Two public hearings $200 (minimum) /each = $400</DTAB> <DTAB>Site visit = $200.00 minimum</DTAB> <BLANK> Our fee <UNDER>does not</UNDER> include the filing fee, cost of the legal ad to be published in the local newspaper of the cost of the postage to notify abutters; all which will be reflected on your bill as an out of pocket expense. <TAB>Our surveyors shall stake out the lot for the Conservation site visit.</TAB> <BLANK> <CENTER>The fee for this service is $350.00</CENTER>

TaskStructure.Header: Board of Health Variance / State Variance
TaskStructure.Body: We shall file a Variance/Local Upgrade Approval Application with the %TOWN% Board of Health and the Department of Environmental Protection. Abutters will be notified of the hearing by certified mail/return receipt requested and we shall attend the public hearing (estimate of 1 hearing). Once the Board of Health approval letter is received we shall file an Application for Local Upgrade Approval with the State, if required. <FEE></FEE> Our fee <UNDER>does not</UNDER> include the cost of the postage to notify abutters; this will be reflected on your bill as an out of pocket expense.

During the design development of this project we have determined that a bottomless sand filter will be necessary to repair your septic system. This requires additional engineering efforts in designing pressure distribution and treatment systems required for the technology.

The Building Inspector requires that a certified plan be submitted with your Building Permit application. We refer to this plan as a Building Inspector plan which shows the proposed location of the house and all pertinent zoning offsets. <FEE></FEE>

We shall file a Chapter 91 Simplified Waterways License Application with the DEP. We shall also prepare all necessary plans to accompany the application. <FEE></FEE> <CENTER>Our fee does not include the $65 DEP application fee.</CENTER>

Once the construction of the lot is completed and you have met all of the Conditions in the Order of Conditions we shall inspect the site, perform an isolated topographic mapping, prepare an as-built plan and prepare a letter requesting a Certificate of Compliance as well as the necessary Form 8A (Request for Certificate of Compliance). <FEE></FEE> Our fee does not include the $%TOWNFEE% Town application fee.
We shall perform construction layout on an as-needed basis at an hourly rate of $110/hour. We have used a budgetary number of $880 for this task.

<NUMLIST> In accordance with Special Conditions – Attachment IV – Erosion Control, paragraph 1 of the Order of Conditions issued by the Groveland Conservation Commission, prior to any “earth moving activities” all erosion control devices shall be in place and a pre-construction meeting shall be held with the Conservation Commission, applicant, project engineer, environmental monitor and site contractor. In accordance with Special Conditions – Attachment IV – Erosion Control, paragraph 2 of the Order of Conditions issued by the Groveland Conservation Commission, an environmental monitor shall be hired to perform weekly site inspections to review the status of erosion control barriers and compliance with the Determination of Applicability. On a monthly basis, the monitor shall provide a summary report on the site inspections to the Conservation Commission. </NUMLIST> <CENTER>The following fees shall be charged for these services:</CENTER> <CENTER>Environmental Monitor $105/hour</CENTER> <CENTER>Project Engineer $135/hour</CENTER>

We shall prepare an existing conditions plan of the property showing the lot lines, the topography of the lot, structures, pavement and visible utilities. Attorney McCann can use this plan to accompany her permit application. <FEE></FEE>

Our surveyors shall visit the site to locate any existing monuments in the neighborhood. The plan we have of your lot does not show existing monuments. Our additional research should uncover more monuments. Finding monuments in the field that agree with plans of record is difficult, but necessary so that we can stake your lot lines. If no monuments are found or if monuments are found and don’t agree with record plans we will inform you. <FEE></FEE> If the location exceeds 4 hours we shall charge you at a rate of $125/hour thereafter.

We shall perform a property line survey of your property. This will require research at the Town Hall and Registry of Deeds to gather information regarding your property and abutting properties in the form of deeds and plans. We shall locate the existing survey monumentation to establish property line control. While on site we shall locate the wetland resource areas that are delineated and the test pits that were conducted. <BLANK> <DTAB>We shall prepare a Form A plan subdividing the property into %LOTNUM% lots. We shall present this plan, including applications, to the Planning Board for endorsement. We shall present this plan, including applications, to the Planning Board for endorsement.</DTAB> <FEE></FEE> <DTAB>This fee includes our attendance at 2 Planning Board meetings at which we will have the plan endorsed. Our fee does not include the Town filing fee.</DTAB> <BLANK> <NOTE>Any meeting or site visit time over 2 hours will be charged at a rate of $125/hour.</NOTE>

Our surveyors shall perform an initial field survey to recon and locate any monuments shown on record plans. Once we have located these monuments we will bring the information back to the office to analyze it. <FEE></FEE>

Our surveyors shall then return to the site to layout your lot lines. We shall install iron pins in your lot corners and will install wooden stakes in between these points at intervals so the lot lines can be easily viewed. <FEE></FEE>
Our surveyors shall locate the flags by field survey and verify that the existing site conditions have not changed substantially. <FEE></FEE>
Our surveyors shall then locate the flags by field survey and verify that our existing field data on file is accurate. Any discrepancies shall be located. <FEE></FEE>

<BULLET> We shall perform a topographic survey of your property to verify the lowest grade adjacent to the dwelling. We will establish the required elevation benchmark system. We shall prepare the required LOMA application to remove the dwelling from the floodplain. This application shall be submitted electronically. A copy of the supporting data for the application will be forwarded to you electronically; if you would like hard copies please let us know. </BULLET>

<NUMLIST> We shall perform research at the Town Hall and Registry of Deeds in order to gather information on this property in the form of deeds and plans. </NUMLIST> <CENTER>The fee for this service is $250.00</CENTER> <BLANK> <NUMLIST> We shall perform field work on your site establishing existing elevations around your existing structure. We shall also take photos as required in the LOMA application. We will also establish a USGS elevation benchmark for our work. </NUMLIST> <CENTER>The fee for this service is $450.00</CENTER> <BLANK> <NUMLIST> We shall prepare a sketch plan showing the existing structure and the existing grades around the structure. </NUMLIST> <CENTER>The fee for this service is $275.00</CENTER> <BLANK> <NUMLIST> We shall prepare the LOMA online application to remove the structure from the 100 year floodplain. </NUMLIST> <DTAB>The fee for this service shall be charged hourly at a rate of $135/hour.</DTAB> <DTAB>We estimate a budget of $475.00.</DTAB>

<NUMLIST> We shall perform field work on your site establishing existing elevations around your existing structure; we shall also take photos. We will establish a USGS elevation benchmark on the same datum as the FEMA maps. </NUMLIST> <CENTER>The fee for this service is $550.00</CENTER> <BLANK> <NUMLIST> We shall prepare the LOMA application or eLOMA (if applicable) to remove the structure from the 100 year floodplain. </NUMLIST> <CENTER>The fee for this service is $600.00</CENTER>

Our office shall prepare a Notice of Intent describing the work proposed within the buffer zone of the bordering vegetated wetlands. This application will be filed with the Conservation Commission, abutters will be notified of the hearing by <BOLD>certified mail/return receipt requested OR CERTIFICATE OF MAILING (depends on the Town)</BOLD>, we shall attend the public hearings (estimate of 2 hearings) and we shall conduct one site visit as scheduled by the Commission. <FEE></FEE> Our fee breakdown is as follows: <DTAB>Notice of Intent…………………………………….………….$725.00</DTAB> <DTAB>Two public hearings $200 (minimum) /each……$400.00</DTAB> <DTAB>Site visit……………………………………………………...…….$200.00 (minimum)</DTAB> <BLANK> <NOTE>Any meeting or site visit time over 2 hours will be charged at a rate of $125/hour.</NOTE> <BLANK> Our fee <UNDER>does not</UNDER> include the filing fee, cost of the legal ad to be published in the local newspaper or the cost of the postage to notify abutters; all which will be reflected on your bill as an out of pocket expense. <BLANK> Please be aware that it is routine that during the public hearing process comments made by Commission members and/or abutters may cause revisions to the design plans which do not substantially affect the intent of the design. If revisions are required that result in additional charges we will review same with you prior to revising the plan. These revisions would be reflected as an extra on your invoice. <BLANK> Once the hearing is closed and the project is approved, the Commission will issue an Order of Conditions. Once all of the site improvement work is completed, a request for a Certificate of Compliance (CoC) from the Commission is required. While we cannot anticipate the full scope of the CoC at this time, since this has to be negotiated with the Commission during the permitting process, it should be noted that typically this process requires an as-built survey plan, engineering certificate, application, a meeting and a site walk. Upon completion of the project, we can provide you with an estimate for this work.

While we are performing our survey it is customary to enter abutting land to locate existing monuments. If this is necessary, we will knock on your abutters door to ask permission to enter their land. If a neighbor informs us that they do not want us on their land we will then officially notify them, by certified mail, in accordance with the “Trespass Law” MGL Chapter 266, §120C. If this is necessary, there will be an extra charge of $200 (this fee is not included in this proposal).

Our office shall prepare a Request for Determination of Applicability describing the work proposed within the buffer zone of the bordering vegetated wetlands. This application will be filed with the Conservation Commission, abutters will be notified of the hearing by certified mail/return receipt requested, we shall attend the public hearings (estimate of 2 hearings) and we shall conduct one site visit as scheduled by the Commission. <FEE></FEE> <TAB>Our fee breakdown is as follows:</TAB> <DTAB>RDA………………………………………………………………….$425.00</DTAB> <DTAB>Two public hearings $200 (minimum) /each……$400.00 </DTAB> <DTAB>Site visit…………………………………………...……………….$200.00 (minimum)</DTAB> <BLANK> <NOTE>Any meeting or site visit time over 2 hours will be charged at a rate of $125/hour.</NOTE> <BLANK> Our fee <UNDER>does not</UNDER> include the filing fee, cost of the legal ad to be published in the local newspaper or the cost of the postage to notify abutters; all which will be reflected on your bill as an out of pocket expense.

We shall perform research at the Town Hall and Registry of Deeds in order to gather information on this property in the form of deeds and plans. We will also research the Board of Health records for an as-built plan of your septic system. <FEE></FEE>

Upon the installation of the septic system, but prior to backfilling we shall conduct an inspection and prepare a Septic System As-built Plan pursuant to the Board of Health Regulations. <FEE></FEE> <BOLD>Please contact our office 1 week prior to the installation of the system so that we may schedule our field crew for you.</BOLD> <BLANK> From time to time septic installers do not install the system in accordance with our plans and we must return to the site after our instructed changes are made. This prompts an additional charge to you which we recommend you pass on to your installer if this event occurs. <BLANK> The following 2 as-built services may be required by the Town Health Agent during the installation of your system and prior to the Town’s final approval: <BLANK> <NUMLIST> At times the Board of Health requires that an inspection be performed when your leaching area is excavated. If such an inspection is required an additional $135 will be charged for this service. If your system requires a pump chamber, the pumps and pump chamber have to be tested with the Health Agent present at a separate time. An additional cost of $135 will be charged. </NUMLIST>

Our office shall prepare a Site Development Plan showing the lot lines, the topography of the lot, the wetland resource areas and all proposed improvements. This plan will be submitted as part of the Notice of Intent application outlined in Task 5 below. This plan can also be used for your Building Permit application. <FEE></FEE>

We shall conduct percolation tests and deep hole observation test pits, in the presence of the Health Agent. We shall complete the soil testing application and will ask that you provide the $%TOWNFEE% Town filing fee. Prior to soil testing, the site shall be pre-marked for Dig Safe, and a trench permit will be obtained by the backhoe operator. <FEE></FEE> This fee is based on 4 hours of the soil evaluator’s time. If more time is needed due to slower soils being present or the necessity to return to the site at a later date a fee of $100/hour for the soil evaluator will be charged thereafter. <BLANK> A backhoe is needed to conduct these tests. We shall hire a backhoe and will ask that their office bill you directly for their work. The backhoe operator will rough grade the area of the yard that was disturbed for test holes, but no grass seed will be put down. <BLANK> During the time we do the soil testing we will evaluate any wetlands which may impact our design. We will provide you with a separate proposal for this work if filing with the Conservation Commission is required. <BLANK> Once the soil testing is completed we will prepare a preliminary design of your system. At this time we will assess if any local waivers to the Board of Health Regulations or variances from Title 5 are needed. We will make that assessment and will provide you with a separate proposal for this work, if required.

Once the topographic information is compiled in our office we shall prepare the replacement Sanitary Disposal System Design in accordance with the local Board of Health Regulations and the State Environmental Code, Title 5. <FEE></FEE> <BULLET> At times a sieve analysis (conducted by a certified lab) is used in lieu of a percolation test due to saturated soil conditions on site. If it is determined that a sieve analysis is required, then an additional $150/soil sample will be charged. Generally 1-2 soil samples are required. If an alternative technology component is required as part of the system design we shall contact you prior to the commencement of any design work and will inform you of expected additional costs which would be shown as “extras” on your invoices. If your installer requires us to layout the location of the septic system, prior to installation, an additional $330 will be charged. At times sanitary disposal systems involve pumping to the leaching facility. If your system requires a pump an additional $250 will be charged. </BULLET> Once this plan is complete we shall file an application with the Board of Health. A filing fee of $%TOWNFEE% made payable to the Town is due upon submission of this application.

We are prepared to layout your %SIDE% side line (lot line between your lot and land now or formerly of %AUTOFILL%) which measures %FEETNUM% feet. We shall install an iron pin in %CORNERNUM% lot corners and will install wooden stakes in between these points at intervals so the line can be easily viewed.
<FEE></FEE>
Our surveyors shall install permanent monuments in the form of iron pipes at your 5 lot corners; we will also install wooden stakes between the points as necessary.
Based on our current work load we will be sub-contracting %SUBCONTRACTING% to perform the required survey work in order to expedite your project.
If property line monumentation is not found or the monumentation found does not match the record plan, and additional work and research is needed, then you will be charged at a rate of $110/hour.

Our surveyors shall conduct a topographic mapping in sufficient detail to prepare a site plan. <FEE></FEE> If property line monumentation is not found or the monumentation found does not match the record plan and additional work and research is needed then you will be charged at a rate of $110/hour.

We shall produce a topographic mapping of the site by aerial survey which would be performed by Col-East, Inc. We shall provide horizontal and vertical control for the development of the topographic plans. <FEE></FEE>

We shall coordinate with DeRosa Environmental to delineate the edge of the wetland resource area as required by the state and town bylaws, and we shall prepare the required DEP Field Data Forms. <FEE></FEE>

<DTAB>We shall delineate the edge of the wetland resource area as required by the state and town bylaws, and we shall prepare the required DEP Field Data Forms.</DTAB> <FEE></FEE> <DTAB>If the delineation of the resource areas exceeds 4 hours we shall charge you at a rate of $105/hour thereafter.</DTAB> <BLANK> If any environmental consultation is required we shall charge you at a rate of $105/hour. <BLANK> If any engineering consultation is required we shall charge you at a rate of $135/hour.

We shall delineate the edge of the wetland resource area as required by the state and town bylaws, and we shall submit the required DEP Field Data Forms. We shall also delineate the edge of the top of bank of the stream as defined by the state and town bylaws, and we shall perform the required calculations with regards to the status of said stream (i.e. intermittent or perennial). <FEE></FEE> If the delineation of the resource areas exceeds 4 hours we shall charge you at a rate of $105/hour thereafter.

In accordance with Condition %CONDNUM%, the restored areas must be monitored for 2 complete growing seasons and monitoring reports shall be submitted to the Conservation Commission for review and approval in the Spring and Fall months (4 reports total). <FEE></FEE>

Our office shall prepare a Special Permit application and file same with the Zoning Board of Appeals. Abutters will be notified of the hearing and we shall attend the public hearings (estimate of 2 hearings). Please note that the Zoning Board requires Planning Board recommendation before issuing a Special Permit; this will require our attendance at one Planning Board meeting. <FEE></FEE> Our fee breakdown is as follows: <DTAB>Special Permit application………………………………………………..………….……$450.00</DTAB> <DTAB>Two Zoning Board public hearings $200/each (minimum)…………….…$400.00</DTAB> <DTAB>One Planning Board meeting……………………………………………………………$200.00</DTAB> <DTAB>Filing fee……………………………………………………………………………………………$</DTAB> <BLANK> <NOTE>Any meeting or site visit time over 2 hours will be charged at a rate of $125/hour.</NOTE> <BLANK> Our fee <UNDER>does not</UNDER> include the filing fee, cost of the legal ad to be published in the local newspaper or the cost of the postage to notify abutters; all which will be reflected on your bill as out of pocket expenses.
